posts.post_content: You've probably seen what's online but I recall seeing a super nice SGC 30 from Kit Young on ebay recently.  Very slight paper loss but looked nicer.

Thanks Peter.  Yeah I made an offer but they're waiting to see if it will sell at the full price first.  The paper loss scares me a bit.

There's also a SGC 3 up that looks a bit over graded with the rough top border for the price.  

Interested to see if there are any Net54's looking to sell post holidays...!

[quote name="ajjohnsonsoxfan" post=1485428]Thanks Peter.  Yeah I made an offer but they're waiting to see if it will sell at the full price first.  The paper loss scares me a bit.

There's also a SGC 3 up that looks a bit over graded with the rough top border for the price.  

Interested to see if there are any Net54's looking to sell post holidays...![/QUOTE]

All you can do is be patient, it took me quite a while to find mine.
to pull the trigger - bought right here on the BST. As Peter said - be patient. There's a fair number of them in the marketplace every year - get the best one you can afford..........
Thought you guys would like to see the Anson I picked up.  Love this card!
Awesome card, I'm actually looking to pick one up as well.  Personally I think it's one of the best looking cards in the hobby.
That's a great card right there!  Congrats on the pickup. Definitely one I would like someday as well

[quote name="pokerplyr80" post=1489763]Awesome card, I'm actually looking to pick one up as well.  Personally I think it's one of the best looking cards in the hobby.[/QUOTE]

Jessie I agree 100%.  Something about the colors on this card make it something special.  It just pops.  Doesn't hurt that Anson was the first player to have 3,000 hits!
Well that didn't take long.  Top ten card IMO.

Hey I've got of those........a little beat but I still have one.  Oh yeah, and PSA has it mislabeled.  I guess I should get that changed.
Robert

[IMG]http://i1135.photobucket.com/albums/m624/milbroco/PSA%20Baseball/PSA%20Baseball%20Pre%201950/1888%20Anson438_zpshthzpyhj.jpg[/IMG]
[IMG]http://i1135.photobucket.com/albums/m624/milbroco/PSA%20Baseball/PSA%20Baseball%20Pre%201950/1888%20Anson%20Rev439_zpseianphg2.jpg[/IMG]
Robert a nice example given the creases and paper loss which don't take too much away from coloring and display of face and jersey.  Such an iconic card!
